intro: Phryganocydia phellosperma, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and sandy soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds that contribute to its spread in arid environments.
